home.title: Welcome to ISA DeepData
home.subtitle: Explore the ocean's depths with our interactive maps and resources.

about.title: About ISA DeepData
about.leadText: ISA DeepData provides innovative solutions for deep-sea data analysis.
about.description: Our platform harnesses cutting-edge technology to transform raw marine data into actionable insights, empowering stakeholders to make informed decisions about sustainable marine resource management.

innovativeAnalytics.title: Innovative Analytics
innovativeAnalytics.description: Transform raw marine data into clear, actionable insights.

marineInsights.title: Marine Insights
marineInsights.description: Leverage expert analysis for sustainable marine management.

collaborativeExpertise.title: Collaborative Expertise
collaborativeExpertise.description: Partner with industry leaders to drive innovation and excellence.

joinSection.title: Join Our Deep Data Revolution
joinSection.description: Discover how ISA DeepData is transforming the marine industry. Explore our interactive tools, comprehensive reports, and cutting-edge research to stay ahead in the world of deep-sea data.

hero.title: ISA Strategic Plan
hero.subtitle: Guiding the sustainable future of deep seabed mining.

about.title: About the Strategic Plan
about.description: The ISA Strategic Plan outlines our vision for a balanced, sustainable, and scientifically informed approach to deep seabed resource management. It provides a roadmap for effective regulation, research, and capacity-building, ensuring that exploration and exploitation benefit all of humanity.

regulation.title: Robust Regulation
regulation.description: Establishing strong frameworks to govern seabed activities.
regulation.details: Our robust regulatory framework is designed to provide clear guidelines and enforceable measures. By incorporating periodic reviews and continuous stakeholder engagement, we ensure that our regulations remain responsive and effective, fostering an environment of accountability and transparency.

environment.title: Environmental Protection
environment.description: Preserving marine ecosystems for future generations.
environment.details: Environmental protection is at the heart of our mission. We implement comprehensive conservation measures, including regular environmental assessments and proactive monitoring programs, to ensure the sustainable management of marine ecosystems. This approach not only protects biodiversity but also promotes long-term ecological resilience.

collaboration.title: Global Collaboration
collaboration.details: Global collaboration is essential for harnessing the collective expertise of our international partners. By working closely with global stakeholders, regulatory bodies, and scientific communities, we strive to build a cohesive and innovative framework that benefits all parties involved. This spirit of partnership ensures that we share knowledge, harmonize best practices, and jointly address the challenges of deep seabed mining.

download.title: Download the Strategic Plan
download.description: Access the full ISA Strategic Plan document and explore the key objectives, regulations, and initiatives shaping the future of deep seabed mining.

hero.title: The Mining Code
hero.subtitle: A comprehensive set of rules, regulations and procedures for sustainable exploration and exploitation of marine minerals.

about.title: About the Mining Code
about.description: The "Mining Code" refers to the complete framework issued by the International Seabed Authority to regulate prospecting, exploration, and exploitation of marine minerals in the international seabed Area. It encompasses regulations, recommendations, and procedures designed to ensure that seabed activities are carried out responsibly and benefit all of humankind.

polymetallic.title: Polymetallic Nodules
polymetallic.description: Regulations for exploring nodules rich in nickel, copper, cobalt, and manganese.

sulphides.title: Polymetallic Sulphides
sulphides.description: Guidance on sustainable exploration of seafloor massive sulphides.

cobalt.title: Cobalt-Rich Crusts
cobalt.description: Regulations for crusts containing cobalt, iron, and other metals.

details.title: Regulatory Framework
details.description1: The Mining Code is continually evolving to address new technologies and environmental considerations. It is supplemented by recommendations from the Legal and Technical Commission, ensuring that the best available scientific and technical information is integrated into regulations.
details.description2: The ISA also works on draft exploitation regulations, commonly referred to as the "Mining Code," which outline the responsibilities of contractors and States sponsoring them, environmental protection measures, and financial payment structures.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.subtitle: At ISA DeepData, we harness the power of deep-sea data to drive sustainable marine innovation.
mission.description: Discover the core elements that drive our commitment to sustainable and innovative marine data management.

objective1.title: Sustainability
objective1.description: Promote responsible and sustainable management of seabed resources.

objective2.title: Marine Protection
objective2.description: Support initiatives that safeguard and preserve marine ecosystems.

objective3.title: Open Data Access
objective3.description: Provide transparent, high-quality deep-sea research data for informed decision-making.

objective4.title: Global Collaboration
objective4.description: Foster cooperation among member states and research institutions worldwide.

impact.title: Driving Innovation & Impact
impact.description1: Our platform not only deciphers complex marine data but also sparks innovative solutions that transform the marine industry. By integrating advanced analytics with sustainable practices, ISA DeepData enables groundbreaking discoveries and empowers informed decision-making.
impact.description2: We partner with global experts to ensure that every insight contributes to a healthier and more sustainable ocean ecosystem.

overview.title: Overview
overview.paragraph1: The user of this website constitutes agreement with the following terms and conditions. The International Seabed Authority (ISA) maintains this website (the "Site") as a courtesy to those who may choose to access it ("Users"). The information presented is for informational purposes only.
overview.paragraph2: ISA grants permission to Users to visit the Site and to download, copy and print the information, documents and materials (collectively, "Materials") for the User's personal, non-commercial use, subject to more specific restrictions that may apply.

disclaimers.title: Disclaimers
disclaimers.paragraph1: Materials provided on the Site are provided "as is," without warranty of any kind, either express or implied. ISA does not make any warranties or representations as to the accuracy or completeness of any such Materials.
disclaimers.paragraph2: Under no circumstances shall ISA be liable for any loss, damage, liability or expense incurred or suffered that is claimed to have resulted from the use of the Site, including, without limitation, any fault, error, omission, interruption or delay.

immunities.title: Preservation of Immunities
immunities.paragraph1: Nothing herein shall constitute or be considered to be a limitation upon or a waiver of the privileges and immunities of ISA, which are specifically reserved.

general.title: General
general.paragraph1: ISA reserves its exclusive right in its sole discretion to alter, limit, or discontinue the Site or any Materials in any respect. ISA shall have no obligation to take the needs of any User into consideration in connection therewith.
general.paragraph2: ISA reserves the right to deny in its sole discretion any user access to this Site or any portion thereof without notice. No waiver by ISA of any provision of these Terms and Conditions shall be binding except as set forth in writing and signed by its duly authorized representative.

amendments.title: Notification of Amendments
amendments.paragraph1: ISA reserves the right to amend this policy at its own discretion. If you do not agree to any such modifications, you should immediately discontinue use of the Site.

hero.title: Protection of the Marine Environment
hero.subtitle: Preserving ocean ecosystems for a sustainable future.

about.title: Our Commitment to Marine Conservation
about.description: The International Seabed Authority is dedicated to ensuring that all deep seabed activities are carried out with the utmost regard for the marine environment. Our policies and practices are designed to protect sensitive ecosystems, preserve biodiversity, and promote sustainable use of marine resources.

conservation.title: Conservation Measures
conservation.description: Implementing robust measures to safeguard marine habitats.

monitoring.title: Environmental Monitoring
monitoring.description: Utilizing advanced technology to monitor ocean health in real time.

research.title: Scientific Research
research.description: Supporting research initiatives to understand and mitigate impacts on marine ecosystems.

hero.title: Exploration Contracts
hero.subtitle: Enabling sustainable and transparent seabed exploration for the benefit of all humanity

about.title: About Exploration Contracts
about.description: The International Seabed Authority grants contracts for the exploration of mineral resources in the international seabed Area. These legally binding agreements outline the rights and obligations of contractors, ensuring that exploration activities adhere to environmental safeguards, reporting requirements, and the overarching principle of the common heritage of mankind.

legal.title: Legal Framework
legal.description: Each contract operates under strict rules to maintain transparency and accountability.

environmental.title: Environmental Safeguards
environmental.description: Contractors must follow best practices to protect marine ecosystems.

research.title: Research & Data Sharing
research.description: Promoting scientific research and knowledge exchange to advance seabed exploration.

polymetallic.title: Polymetallic Nodules
polymetallic.description: Contracts for exploration of polymetallic nodules on the seabed

sulphides.title: Polymetallic Sulphides
sulphides.description: Contracts for exploration of polymetallic sulphides in hydrothermal vents

cobalt.title: Cobalt-rich Crusts
cobalt.description: Contracts for exploration of cobalt-rich ferromanganese crusts on seamounts

details.title: Contractors & Sponsoring States
details.paragraph1: Exploration contracts are typically awarded to entities sponsored by a State Party to the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea. These sponsoring States bear responsibility for ensuring that contractors comply with regulations and uphold environmental and financial obligations.
details.paragraph2: The ISA regularly reviews contractor performance, requiring detailed annual reports on exploration activities, environmental baseline studies, and any potential impacts on the marine environment.

map.title: Exploration Areas
map.description: View the geographic distribution of current exploration contracts around the world.

hero.title: Workshops & Webinars
hero.subtitle: Explore our collection of workshops and webinars related to deep seabed exploration and environmental protection.

about.title: Knowledge Sharing
about.description: The ISA regularly organizes workshops and webinars to share knowledge, build capacity, and promote international collaboration in deep-sea research and sustainable exploitation of seabed resources.

capacity.title: Capacity Building
capacity.description: Enhancing the capabilities of developing States to participate in deep seabed activities.

knowledge.title: Knowledge Transfer
knowledge.description: Facilitating the exchange of scientific knowledge and technical expertise among stakeholders.

networking.title: Global Networking
networking.description: Connecting researchers, policymakers, and industry experts from around the world.

details.title: Workshop Details
details.description: Our workshops cover a wide range of topics, including environmental management, legal frameworks, scientific research, and technological innovations in deep seabed mining.

featuredTopics.label: Featured topics include:
featuredTopics.topics: environmental impact assessments, biodiversity conservation, taxonomic standardization, geological survey methodologies, data management, and regulatory frameworks.

userManual.description: The ISA DeepData User Manual provides detailed instructions and guidance on how to effectively use all features of the platform. It includes step-by-step tutorials, explanations of data visualization tools, and best practices for data exploration and analysis.

gallery.pageDescription: Browse deep-sea images and videos from the ISA DeepData gallery
gallery.title: Deep-Sea Media Gallery
gallery.description: Explore a collection of deep-sea images and videos from various exploration missions and research activities.
gallery.matchPortMessage: Try to match one of these ports in your code, or check your API's launchSettings.json file.
gallery.noResults: No media found matching your filters.

errors.timeout: Request timed out. Please check your connection and try again.
errors.network: Network error: Unable to connect to the API server. We tried ports 5802 and 5062. Please ensure your backend API is running and accessible.
errors.connection: Connection refused: The server rejected the connection. Make sure your API is running and CORS is properly configured.
errors.unknown: An unknown error occurred while fetching data
errors.bothPorts: Connection failed on both ports (5802, 5062). Please check if your API server is running and accessible.

filter.title: Media Filters
filter.noMatchingItems: No items match the current filter for download.

export.title: ISA DeepData Gallery Export
export.error: There was an error preparing your download. Please try again.

map.title: ISA Exploration Areas
map.description: Interactive map of deep seabed exploration contracts and areas regulated by the International Seabed Authority. Use the filters on the left to explore by mineral type, contract status, location, and sponsoring state. Click the map controls button (bottom right) to toggle visibility of areas, blocks, stations, and cruises. View the Info tab in map controls for a complete legend. Use the Display tab to show the summary panel with statistics about visible data. Click on any map element for detailed information and use the zoom controls to navigate the map

explore.title: Explore Contract Areas
explore.description: Use the search function to quickly find contractors, areas, blocks, and stations. Click on markers for detailed information.

resources.title: Deep Seabed Resources
resources.description: The ISA regulates exploration of minerals in the international seabed area, which covers approximately 54% of the world's oceans.

transparency.title: Data Transparency
transparency.description: All contract information is available as part of ISA's commitment to transparency in deep seabed activities and environmental protection.

display.summaryDescription: The summary panel displays statistics about currently visible exploration data.
display.tip: When you select a contractor, the map will automatically zoom to its areas.

info.stationsDesc: Exploration or research sites with collected data
info.filterTip: Use filters on the left to search by contractor or region

files.title: File Management Library
files.description: Browse and download official documents from contractors. Use filters to narrow down files by country, contractor, theme, or year.
files.instructions: Click on any column header to sort the data. Click on a row to view detailed information about the file. The table displays essential metadata for each document, allowing for quick scanning and comparison of available resources.

table.noResults: No results match your current filters

samples.title: Sample Management
samples.description: Explore all collected samples and their metadata. Filter by sample type, habitat, matrix, or analysis type.

table.noResults: No samples match your filter criteria. Try adjusting your filters.
